item.title: Ademption add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ademption add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Ademption add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Ademption add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "For, while the tale of how we suffer, and how we are delighted, and how we may triumph is never new, it always must be heard. There isn't any other tale to tell, it's the only light we've got in all this darkness." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Bernard Malamud
item.description: "What suffering has taught me is the uselessness of suffering." -- Bernard Malamud

item.title: Ademption add a quote by William Gibson
item.description:
"The future is already here â€“ it's just not evenly distributed.
<i>The Economist, December 4, 2003</i>" -- William Gibson

item.title: Ademption add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ademption add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Christian BÃ¶k
item.description: "Blond trollops who don go-go boots flop pompoms nonstop to do promos for floorshows. Wow! Hot blonds who doff cotton frocks show off soft bosoms. Hot to trot, two blonds who smooch now romp on cold wood floors for crowds of morons, most of whom hoot or howl: whoop, whoop" -- Christian BÃ¶k

item.title: Ademption add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "You have to remember that it is impossible to commit a crime while reading a book." -- John Waters

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "I don't believe that happiness is possible, but I think tranquility is." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Gertrude Stein
item.description: "If you can't say anything nice about anyone else, come sit next to me." -- Gertrude Stein

item.title: Ademption add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "Civilised life, you know, is based on a huge number of illusions in which we all collaborate willingly. The trouble is we forget after a while that they are illusions and we are deeply shocked when reality is torn down around us." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Everybody gets told to write about what they know. The trouble with many of us is that at the earlier stages of life we think we know everything- or to put it more usefully, we are often unaware of the scope and structure of our ignorance." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Perhaps history this century, thought Eigenvalue, is rippled with gathers in its fabric such that if we are situated, as Stencil seemed to be, at the bottom of a fold, it's impossible to determine warp, woof, or pattern anywhere else. By virtue, however, of existing in one gather it is assumed there are others, compartmented off into sinuous cycles each of which had come to assume greater importance than the weave itself and destroy any continuity. Thus it is that we are charmed by the funny-looking automobiles of the '30's, the curious fashions of the '20's, the particular moral habits of our grandparents. We produce and attend musical comedies about them and are conned into a false memory, a phony nostalgia about what they were. We are accordingly lost to any sense of continuous tradition. Perhaps if we lived on a crest, things would be different. We could at least see." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "I mean what they and their hired psychiatrists call delusional systems. Needless to say, â€˜delusionsâ€™ are always officially defined. We do not have to worry about questions of real or unreal. They only talk out of expediency. Itâ€™s the system that matters. How the data arrange themselves inside it. Some are consistent, others fall apart. " -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "Laboring through a world every day more stultified, which expected salvation in codes and governments, ever more willing to settle for suburban narratives and diminished payoffs--what were the chances of finding anyone else seeking to transcend that, and not even particularly aware of it?" -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Ademption add a quote by Tony Kushner
item.description: "You have a good heart and you think the good thing is to be guilty and kind but it's not always kind to be gentle and soft, there's a genuine violence softness and kindness visit on people. Sometimes self-interested is the most generous thing you can be. " -- Tony Kushner
